result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Thomas

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander M Thomas in court without counsel. There is an agreement. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.

Court orders:
court costs and surcharges
DNA sample and surcharge
LETC - Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 5/25/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 6/2/2022.

(10:16 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexander M Thomas in court without counsel. 
Defendant advises did speak with the District Attorney's Office and isn't sure of what the offer is.
State provides a copy of the offer to the defendant and requests new settlement conference and return hearing.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 20, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through third party. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Court order to amend bond and conditions of bond to remove the condition of no contact with A.T. or A.T.'s residence and add the condition of no acts or threats of violence. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect until further order of the court.
CK 43817 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail refunded.

Conditions:
No contact with A.T. or A.T.'s residence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through third party. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Case called at 11:36 AM.
Defendant Alexander M Thomas in court without counsel. Attorney Monica Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/6/22 at 2:30 PM.
RTN: 5/25/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with A.T. or A.T.'s residence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through third party. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
